author: jochembrouwer
content: Hey all, I have a quick comment about EIPs. There are some terms in EIPs which are not defined, but it is assumed that everyone knows whatever it is. For instance, `//` is floor division, and `||` is byte concatenation. I would argue that it would be very beneficial if we have a reference document (or maybe even an EIP) where we put these definitions in.

author: sky.cactus
content: EIP-1 and/or eip-template.md.  I recommend getting buy-in from editors first by creating an issue in the repository though (assuming that is still the right place for such a discussion).

author: jochembrouwer
content: I do not see some kind of section in those which defines "common terms" for the EIPs. But I think it would make sense if this is listed in EIP1 since it also mentions those RFCs for the "MUST" and "SHOULD" terms (etc.)

author: samwilsn
content: EIPs probably should define whatever operators they use. I think I remember a few that use `..` or `+` for concatenation as well.
